info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 13 at 3:25PM PDT until October 13 at 6:30PM PDT by NWS San Francisco CA
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, southeastern Marin, southeastern Napa and southeastern Sonoma.
* WHEN...Until 630 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 325 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Napa, San Rafael, Novato, American Canyon, Mill Valley, San Anselmo, Larkspur, Corte Madera, Tiburon, Sausalito, Black Point-Green Point, Lucas Valley-Marinwood, Kentfield, Strawberry, Tamalpais-Homestead, Tamalpais-Homestead Valley, Muir Beach, Ross, Belvedere and Santa Venetia. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM PDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Marin, CA; Napa, CA; Sonoma, CA
